title: Irregular Verbs Forms - Level A2
description: Practica las formas de los verbos irregulares más comunes en inglés. Aprende a reconocer y usar correctamente el pasado simple y participio pasado.

questions.question: What is the past simple form of 'go'?

answerOptions.rationale: 'Go' is an irregular verb. Its past simple form is 'went', not 'goed'.
This is incorrect. 'Go' is irregular, so we don't add -ed.
'Gone' is the past participle, not the past simple form.
'Goes' is the present simple third person form.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct past participle of 'eat'?

answerOptions.rationale: 'Eaten' is the correct past participle of 'eat', used with present perfect.
'Ate' is the past simple form, not the past participle.
'Eat' is irregular, so we don't add -ed.
The base form 'eat' cannot be used after 'have'.

questions.question: What are the three forms of the verb 'write'?

answerOptions.rationale: Correct! The three forms are: base form (write), past simple (wrote), past participle (written).
'Write' is irregular, so we don't add -ed.
The past participle is 'written', not 'wrote'.
The order is wrong. Past simple comes before past participle.

questions.question: Which verb follows the pattern: same form for all three (base, past simple, past participle)?

answerOptions.rationale: 'Cut' remains the same in all three forms: cut - cut - cut.
'Run' changes: run - ran - run.
'Sing' changes: sing - sang - sung.
'Break' changes: break - broke - broken.

questions.hint: Some verbs never change their form!

answerOptions.rationale: 'Flown' is the past participle of 'fly' (fly - flew - flown).
'Flew' is the past simple, not the past participle.
